answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Chinn, 
Unfortunately I was not able to find something as specific as what you are looking for in terms of VOCs from print shops. Although I was able to find a document that discusses local government's role in clean air that you may find useful and an interesting read. 
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/6377
I hope other local government officials are able to weigh in and provide you with a more specific answer. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Chinn Park MAGIC
text:
Hello,
We are seeking any test results, surveys, or assessment with data gathered on VOCs (volatile organic compounds) in a typical print shop environment.  We are hoping to find data similar to the info below. Or anything else that may assist in analyzing the VOCs present.  
Thanking you in advance for your help,
Karen Garrett
Target / Concern              Guideline / Reference
Carbon Dioxide (CO2)
800 – 1,500 parts per million (ppm)
Temperature      
68° - 75° F (winter) / 73° - 79° F (summer)
%RH      Winter (°F)         Summer (°F)
30           68.5 - 76               74 – 80
40           68.5 – 75.5           73.5 – 79.5
50           68.5 – 74.5           73 – 79
60           68 – 74  72.5 – 78
Relative Humidity
30 – 60 % (optimum: 40 – 60 %)
tVOC’s  
< 100 parts per billion (ppb) isobutylene – normal outdoor air
100-400 ppb isobutylene – normal indoor air
500+ ppb isobutylene – potential of IAQ contaminants
Dust
0.15 mg/m3
Carbon Monoxide (CO)
< 5 parts per million (ppm)
Emily Bergstresser, Librarian II
Karen Garrett, Library Services Technician III
Management and Government Information Center
Chinn Park Regional Library
13065 Chinn Park Drive
Prince William,  Virginia 22192
703-792-4880
703-792-4612 fax
magic2@pwcgov.org
title: VOC sampling results for a print shop
